title: Data Science Undergraduate Intern
description:
Dell Technologies Services Undergraduate Data Science Intern

Join us as an Undergraduate Data Science Intern on our Dell Technologies Services team in Hopkinton, MA to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact.

Dell Technologies Services helps customers accelerate their digital journey and achieve outcomes. Through an ecosystem of augmented intelligence, passionate experts, automated processes, and unmatched reach, we deliver end-to-end, modernized services from home to work, IT datacenters to the cloud. Our services are strategic to growth drivers for Dell Technologies overall and continue to experience growth in the sector. Our global team covers Sales, Portfolio Management, Service Delivery, Supply Chain, Data Science, Engineering, and more.

What you’ll achieve

As an Undergraduate Data Science intern you will be responsible for analyzing data and driving growth through programming.

You will:
• Be a part of a large passionate data science community that’s always sharing new learnings, best practices, and a helping hand.
• Work on projects ranging from basic effective methods to cutting-edge experimental methods
• Work alongside peers throughout our 12 week program

Essential Requirements
• Enrolled in a Bachelor’s (BA or BS) program in Computer Science, Data Science, Natural Sciences, Engineering, or related field
• Excellent written communication, with a strong emphasis on verbal communication skills and being able to present to stakeholders.
• Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R, and database languages such as SQL
• Experience with visualization libraries and tools such as matplotlib, Tableau, or Power BI is a plus
• Must be comfortable working with global teams spread across multiple regions

Desirable Requirements
• Solid programming skills to retrieve, process, and analyze data
• Passion for data visualization and communicating data stories

Compensation

Dell is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. The pay range for this position is $18.00 hourly - $37.15 hourly depending on location.

Who we are

We believe that each of us has the power to make an impact. That’s why we put our team members at the center of everything we do. If you’re looking for an opportunity to grow your career with some of the best minds and most advanced tech in the industry, we’re looking for you.

Dell Technologies is a unique family of businesses that helps individuals and organizations transform how they work, live and play. Join us to build a future that works for everyone because Progress Takes All of Us.

Dell Technologies is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. Read the full Equal Employment Opportunity Policy here.

Job ID:R277346

title: 2026 Data & Analytics Consulting Intern
description:
To help our recruiting team focus on your preference, please submit your application for the practice and location that is your top priority. While you can apply to up to three roles within 30 days, prioritizing your top choice is recommended. If you submit a fourth application within the 30 days, you will receive a rejection email indicating that you have reached the limit of applications you can submit.

Launch your consulting journey with West Monroe

West Monroe is seeking Consulting Interns to join our Data & Analytics team aligned to our Technology & Experience (TechEx) Practice. As businesses accumulate vast amounts of data, the challenge lies in extracting actionable insights that drive growth and operational efficiency. Our Data and Analytics Interns play a crucial role in helping clients unlock the full potential of their data through advanced analytics, data science, and data engineering.

As a Data & Analytics Consulting Intern, you will combine business acumen with technical problem-solving skills to deliver impactful solutions. The role requires an understanding of business processes, data analysis capabilities and proficiency in data structures, querying, and programming languages like SQL, Python, or R.

Primary Responsibilities
• Functional Responsibilities:
• Collaborate with client executives and team members to understand organizational needs and recommend appropriate data driven solutions
• Work closely with West Monroe project team members to deliver valuable outcomes
• Initiate and complete project tasks under management guidance
• Evaluate and document client business processes and requirements
• Develop and test investment hypotheses using data science methodologies to drive actionable insights
• Assist in the creation of detailed business cases and strategic recommendations
• Technical Responsibilities:
• Utilize database development and scripting skills (SQL, Python, R) for data manipulation and analysis
• Perform end-to-end data science workflow, from data ingestion and wrangling to analysis and visualization
• Design and develop reports, dashboards, and visualization tools using platforms like Tableau and Power BI
• Develop and implement data management, integration, and data science tools, including ETL processes and machine learning models
• Conduct fit-gap analysis between application functionality and client requirements
• Internal Responsibilities:
• Actively participate in West Monroe's culture and social events
• Expand your knowledge of data science, analytics, and engineering methodologies by participating in competency teams and attending learning sessions

What You'll Bring to the Team
• Sharp analytical thinking and an interest in solving complex problems
• Ability to stay organized and manage priorities in a fast-moving environment
• Demonstrated leadership potential through academics, extracurriculars, or prior work experience
• Clear and effective communication skills, both written and verbal
• A collaborative mindset and enthusiasm for contributing to team success

Curiosity and a passion for continuous learning and innovation

Required Qualifications
• Bachelor's degree in progress, with an expected graduation date between December 2026 and July 2027
• Intern candidates must be legally authorized to work in the United States without limitation or sponsorship now or in the future (e.g., OPT, H-1B visa, TN, etc.)
• Minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0
• Must reside within 50 miles of your assigned office before your start date and throughout the internship; our culture emphasizes team collaboration within a hybrid work model
• Ability and willingness to travel Monday - Thursday (up to 50%); travel expenses covered by West Monroe

PreferredQualifications:
• Majors with a focus in:
• Business Analytics
• Computer Science
• Data Engineering
• Data Science
• Economics
• Informatics
• Information Systems
• Statistics

Preferred Skills:
• Proficiency in querying databases
• Experience with data wrangling, coding (Python, R), and data platforms (Azure Fabric, Databricks, Snowflake)
• Familiarity with data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI)
• Understanding of data warehousing concepts and tools
• Strong problem solving and analytical skills

Join our team and make a lasting impact!

Based on pay transparency guidelines, the pay rate for this role is $39.00.

Other consultancies talk at you.
At West Monroe, we work with you.

We're a global business and technology consulting firm passionate about creating measurable value for our clients, delivering real-world solutions.

The combination of business and technology is not new, but how we bring them together is unique. We're fluent in both. We know that technology alone is not the answer, but how we apply it is. We rely on data to constantly adapt and solve new challenges. Actions that work today with outcomes that generate value for years to come.

At West Monroe, we zero in on the heart of the opportunity, getting to results faster and preparing people for what's next.

You'll feel the difference in how we work. We show up personally. We're right there in the room with you, co-creating through the challenges. With West Monroe, collaboration isn't a lofty promise, but a daily action. We work together with you to turn vision into clear action with lasting impact.

West Monroeis an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer
We believe in treating each employee and applicant for employment fairly and with dignity. We base our employment decisions on merit, experience, and potential, without regard to race, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age, religion, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic prohibited by federal, state or local law. To learn more about diversity, equity and inclusion at West Monroe, visit www.westmonroe.com/inclusion. If you require a reasonable accommodation to participate in our recruiting process, please inquire by sending an email to recruiting@westmonroe.com.

If you are based in California, we encourage you to read West Monroe's Notice at Collection for California residents, provided pursuant to the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) and linked here.
